Note.Details: You can now change the online search engine from Google to whatever you like in Options. There are some pre-defined choices, or you can define a custom url.

Visual Studio App Center is being closed down in March 2025, so the automatic crash and usage reporting is now implemented with Microsoft Application Insights. The data being reported is the same as it was before, it's just being sent to a different service.
Updated third party components.
Added button to toggle the display of line numbers on and off.
Added button to toggle the display of whitespace characters on and off.
Added ability to zoom the text display with Ctrl+mousewheel, Ctrl+ and Ctrl-
Local find in file values weren't getting re-applied when switching between different file type viewers, which could cause a crash on the first switch.
Updated third party components.
Browse button on the ribbon had no image, was tiny and was difficult to click.
Updated third party components.
Microsoft changed the OneDrive url format which broke Grind's update checking. Changed the update check to use a file hosted on arjailer.uk instead.
Improved logging during startup.
Lots of tweaks behind the scenes as a result of refactoring and tidying code.
Updated third party components.
Removed unused features: menu and toolbar interface, advanced search button and command line tool
Changed where the automatic update is launched from to avoid it being quarantined by supposedly intelligent security software that doesn't like it being launched from the user's temp folder.
Some tweaks behind the scenes as a result of tidying code.
Updated third party components.

Due to lack of use and to allow for future user interface changes, the following features will be removed in the next update:

The menu and toolbar interface
The advanced search button
The command line tool

Warnings about these removals have been added in various places and the Advanced Search button is now hidden by default (for the time being it can be re-enabled in Options if required).
Shows the count of ticked files and matches in the status bar.
Updated third party components.

Searching binary files would miss matches if the characters immediately before the match were themselves a partial match, e.g. searching for "test" would not have matched with "tetest" in a binary file. The "te" partial match at the start would have confused it.
The option to run Grind in the system tray at startup wasn't working if set from the tray app.

Upgraded to .NET 8
There are no new features in this version, but the performance improvements in .NET 8 results in increasing the speed of searches.
Splash screen would remain on screen if started with the "force multiple instances" hot key.
Fixed some minor UI bugs I noticed while testing the entire app after the upgrade to .NET 8

The "remember my choice" option when large files are found is now persisted when Grind is restarted. You can also change your choice or reset it back to "ask me what to do" in the Search tab in Options.
Simplified the styling of the main window to make it a bit more Windows 11-ish.
Updated third party components.
Improved the handling of read-only files.
Should now do a better job of making sure the window is visible at startup when a monitor is unavailable.

Added syntax highlighting for some of the most commonly viewed file types that weren't previously highlighted, based on the usage reporting. Includes: Delphi NFM files, TypeScript, YAML, batch files, Visual Studio solution files, .gitignore and more XML file types
Opening file in text editor could crash if the editor is not found.
Added missing third party acknowledgements in About > Third Party Components

Added optional automatic crash and usage reporting using Visual Studio App Center. On first run you get an explanation of what data is sent and the choice to opt in or out. You can change your decision at any time in Options.
Reworked the tray app to support Windows 11 style tooltips, menus and notifications.
Added office files (.docx, .pptx. .xslx) as known masks to the Edit File Masks window (Ctrl+M).
Updated third party components.

Added a new binary file viewer. The old viewer was a Winforms control hosted in the WPF application and would fail to display correctly for some users. The new viewer is a WPF control which should display correctly for all users. The new viewer is used by default but can be disabled in Options > Experimental if it causes problems. If there are no major issues then the old binary viewer will be fully removed in a future update.
Added selectable Longest Line column to the results list. Note that any text file with lines longer than 9,600 characters will be displayed using the binary viewer instead.
Grind now requires .NET Framework 4.8 (required by the new binary file viewer)
Crash on Windows 11 when using the "start with selected text" hot key.

Selecting a file whose line length exceeded the maximum (9,600 characters) before the search was complete caused the application to completely hang while switching to the binary viewer due to threading issues. Worked around this by delaying the switch to the binary viewer until the search is complete.
The Matches Only option didn't work for Office files.
Determining the type of a file could crash if part of the file was in use.

The Options window now reacts better to Windows' Text Size / Make Text Bigger option (which is found in the Accessibility / Ease of Access settings, and is different from the Display Scale / Make Everything Bigger option). It's nowhere near perfect but it now at least tries to take the text size into account.
Added a "remember my choice" option to the large files warning message.
The ribbon interface now uses the selected Windows accent colour.
Workaround for startup crash caused by corrupt Windows Performance Counter settings. The "after last reboot" filter option won't work correctly in this case.
Updated the results list styling to match Windows 10 and 11.
Focusing on the search box at startup still wasn't working. Fixed it more robustly this time.

Updated the SQLite components to the latest version. A previous SQLite update had introduced an intermittent threading issue in the SQLite initialisation, which is hopefully fixed in the latest version.
Restoring column order at startup could sometimes fail and crash the application. This should hopefully be more robust now.

Added support for searching Microsoft Office Open Xml documents (.docx, .pptx and .xlsx files). Readable text is extracted from these files, then searched and displayed as plain text in Grind. Because of the extra processing, searching Office files is considerably slower than searching plain text files. Replace is not supported for these file types. For Word documents, all text is extracted. For Excel, the data includes populated cell references, cell formulas and cell values, arranged by worksheets. For PowerPoint, the data includes all text elements, arranged by slides. To search Office files make sure "search office files" is ticked. See the [HELP#msofficefiles] for more details.
Can now search some files that were previously "in use by another process".
Added "open file location" right-click option to the search errors tab.
When searching "same files", deleted files are now reported as "no longer exists" rather than "access denied".
UTF-16 encoded files with no byte order mark were mis-identified as Windows-1252 encoding.
Switching to the Errors tab and back to Matches would remove the scrollbar highlighting.
Switching to the Errors tab before an item was selected could cause a crash.
Binary file viewer could crash when trying to select more that 2GB of data.
Whole word searches in binary files could mis-identify control characters as word characters.
Logging certain search results to the log file could cause a crash.
Added file mask and exclusion editors with "well known" masks and exclusions.
Every control on the ribbon interface now has usable key tips, shown by tapping Alt.
Updated the default tray icon hot keys to avoid clashes with Windows 10 system shortcuts. Only affects new installations.
Searching "same" or "ticked" files wasn't working with the menu and toolbar interface.

If searching "same" or "ticked" files and the filter is changed so that it would result in no files being searched you are now asked how to proceed: switch to "search folder", clear the filter, or stop the search. Can change this to always switch to "search folder" in Options > Search > Scope

When multiple instances of Grind are running a summary of the last search is now shown in the window title to help distinguish between the instances. Can be turned off in Options > General > Integration
The search and replace error tabs now honour the "show whole file path" option.
Made it more obvious that binary files don't support regex searching. See the [HELP#binaryfiles] for more details.
Tidied up the Matches tab layout.
Focusing on the search box at startup wasn't always working. Hopefully that should now be better.
Updated all third party components to the latest versions.
Filtering by modified date was broken in v1.23
Filters can now be used when searching "same files" and "ticked files".
Fixed DependencySource error on startup.
Added file path filtering to the Filter tab. See [HELP#filter] for details.
Added Ctrl+W shortcut to select the current word under the text cursor.
Changed the close application shortcut to Ctrl+Q.
Can now turn off the use of bold and italic fonts in syntax highlighting if, like me, you find them ugly. The settings are at the bottom of the Options > Syntax Highlighting tab.
Reformatted the version history display.
Updated the Fluent.Ribbon control to the latest version.
Using Ctrl+A to select all text in an edit box no longer also selects all text in the selected file.
New lines and carriage returns in command line search terms are now automatically escaped to \n and \r.
Lots of tweaks behind the scenes as a result of tidying code and writing tests.
Added splash screen progress bar.
Sometimes Notepad++ was not recognised correctly as the default text editor. Improved the matching, so hopefully this is fixed.
A few minor tweaks as a result of writing tests around existing code.
"Start with selected text" and "start with clipboard text" will now pass the text to the running instance if "allow multiple instances" is turned off.
Added a button to view error details if sending a crash report fails.
Fixed crash when trying to strip the byte order mark from the first line of in-use files during searches.
Fixed window placement on high-dpi Windows 10.
Improved rendering quality on high-dpi Windows 10.
Some minor icon and window placement tweaks.
Turned off the "favour same files searching" option by default as it was causing confusion.
A few minor tweaks as a result of writing tests around existing code.

Added "search same files" option, which skips the file finding stage and re-searches the same files as the last search found, cutting a lot of time from a full search. By default searching will switch to this mode whenever possible (e.g. when searching the same folder multiple times, ctrl+click searching, and navigating through the search history). This behaviour can be disabled in Options > Search > Scope. The downside of searching the same files is that files added since the initial search will not be included - switch back to "search folder" if files have been added that you want to search.

Improved whole word matching for non-regex searches. Will now match non-word characters at the start and end of search text. For example, whole word searches for "item." will now match "item.value", and "(int" will now match "action(int x)". This matches the behaviour of regex searches, as well as applications like Visual Studio and Notepad++.
Crash reports are now sent to: github.com/arjailer/bugs
Lots of minor tweaks as a result of writing lots of tests around existing code.
Increased text file maximum line length from 5,000 to 9,600 to match AvalonEdit's maximum line length. Above this files are displayed with the binary file viewer instead.
Binary files no longer try to display Line or Character counts in those results columns.
Selection highlighting size limit options are now also applied to word highlighting.
Now uses a more memory efficient method for loading text files into the text viewer.
Updated all third party components to the latest versions.
Unexpected errors while gathering files could crash the application. They are now reported in the Search Errors tab.
Fixed incorrect detection of newline characters during replace. Was introduced in the v1.15 encoding detection changes.
Results list columns can now be re-ordered or hidden, either by right-clicking on the column headers, or by dragging the column headers in the list.
Showing the whole file path in the results list can now be toggled on and off, either in Options > Results, or by right-clicking on the column headers.

New hot key for overriding the "allow multiple instances" option while starting Grind. Hot keys can be customised by right-clicking on the tray icon and selecting Options. See [HELP#tray] for details.
Roughly 30% improvement in Normal and Extended search speeds due to more efficient string comparisons.

Text files with extremely long lines (over 5,000 characters) would display extremely slowly, often seeming to never finish. This was due to limitations in the AvalonEdit text control, so these files are now displayed with the binary file viewer instead.
Fixed crash if the detected file encoding was not supported by the Windows installation (e.g. Big-5 traditional Chinese character encoding on English installations). Now uses UTF-8 as a fallback.
Minor bug fixes and stability improvements.
Fixed crash loading old settings files.
Added Ctrl+W shortcut to close the main window.
Improved restoring of window positions.
Improved appearance of disabled buttons.
Improved formatting of file and match counts.
File encoding would sometimes be detected incorrectly.
Files that were deleted between finding and searching would crash the search due to missing file size information.
Hardened the drag/drop code to cope with COM exceptions.
Use system proxy settings when checking for updates.
Improved detection of clean vs update installs.
Improved closing of running tray app when installing or uninstalling.
On Windows 10 the taskbar button would always appear on the primary monitor regardless of which monitor the main window was restored to.
Can search for words in the current file with Alt+click, or right-click > "search for selected text in the current file". To accommodate this the Google shortcut has changed to Ctrl+Alt+click.
Added Notepad++ 64-bit and the new Visual Studio Code user installation as predefined text editors in Options > Results > Change text editor > Predefined
Tidied up the way blank lines are handled in the Matches Only view.
Positions in binary files are now reported in hex in the status bar, to match the viewer.
Moving the caret off the end of a very small binary file caused a crash.
Reduced the maximum number of threads used for searching. Has very little impact on search speed, but avoids locking the system when searching multiple large files.
Added large file handling to the command line options.
Command line crashed due to bad implementation of large file size option.
Double-clicking an item before it was ready could cause a crash.
Fixed layout of ribbon on high-dpi Windows 10.
Fixed crash on startup from a clean install.
Added high dpi icons for tray app.
Changed icons to a more modern "flat" style.
Improved restoring maximized windows in multi-monitor setups. E.g. a window maximized on monitor 2 would often jump to monitor 1 when minimized or un-maximized.
Added warning when search includes large files. Can chose to search the large files, exclude them, or stop the search. Default size is 250MB, which can be changed in Options > Search > Large files.

Improved the handling of large files.
The text viewer now reports when files are too large to display instead of just crashing. The text viewer has to load the entire file before it can be displayed, which restricts the size of files it can display. The largest text file successfully searched and displayed on 64-bit Windows was 900MB (which took 15 seconds to search for a three character match, and another 30 seconds to load and display the contents). Larger files will be searched, but not displayed in Grind.
The binary viewer pages the file into memory as you scroll, so it can display much larger files. The largest binary file successfully searched and displayed on 64-bit Windows was 34GB (which took 1 hour 20 minutes to search for a three character match, and then displayed the contents almost instantly).
Fixed crash when displaying a file identified as text which contained mixed line-breaks (CR/LF/CRLF).
Can now invert search matches, so that only files which do NOT match the specified criteria are listed.
Can change the text font and size for displaying file contents in Options > View.
Shows the current line in the scrollbar. Can be disabled in Options > Scrollbar.
Can copy filenames and locations of all ticked files to the clipboard.
Fixed double-clicking on a file sometimes opening the wrong file.
Fixed occasional crash if moving through matches too quickly (e.g. with Ctrl+Left or Ctrl+Right).
Fixed infinite loop if a regex search returned zero-length matches.
Can now optionally search and view binary files. See the [HELP#binaryfiles] for limitations.
Added filter tab allowing searched files to be filtered by size and modified date. Tab is coloured when a filter is set. See [HELP#filter] for details.
Replaced the ribbon control with a more modern version.
Simplified scrollbar styling to make match highlights easier to see.
Can now control the shell extension from the tray app options.
Added extended search mode and the new file size and modified date filters to the command line options.
Updated all third party components to the latest versions.
Positioning of scrollbar match highlights is now more accurate.
Multi-line scrollbar match highlights are now sized correctly.
Fixed multiple find in file matches on the same line sometimes not highlight correctly.
Fixed Grind hanging if large text selections were made with the selected text highlighting option enabled. Avoided by adding a maximum selection size option.
Installer now checks for .NET Framework 4.5.2
Fixed build issue that was causing incorrect plugin versions to be distributed.

Can now search within the displayed file's contents by using the "find in file" box (Ctrl+F). Results are highlighted in green. Navigate with Ctrl+up and Ctrl+down. See the [HELP#findinfile] for more details.
Can search Google for words by holding the Alt key and clicking on the word to search for, or by selecting some text, right-clicking and selecting "search Google for selected text".
Locations of highlighted words and selections are now shown in the scrollbar.
Notification tray app now checks for updates and has a proper About box.
Added update notification pop-ups. Click the pop-up to download the update. See [HELP#updates] for details.
Updated all third party components to the latest versions.
Grind now requires .NET Framework 4.5.2

Improved handling and reporting of registry writing errors. Particularly useful if your anti-virus program has started blocking writes to the registry keys required for running Grind in the notification tray at startup.

Added extended search and replace engine which can handle new lines at the end of lines (e.g. "end
") and tabs within a line (e.g. "		start"). Extended replace can remove new lines (e.g. replacing "end
" with just "end") or insert new lines (e.g. replacing "end" with "end
"). Note that searches are still confined to a single line, so new lines in the middle of a search term (e.g. "end
start") will not be found. See [HELP#replace] for details.
Regex search and replace can now handle new lines and tabs too.
Can drag all found files into other applications, such as Visual Studio or Explorer, by dragging the Matches tab header.
Can drag all ticked files by dragging the tick column header.
Now only checks for updates on startup once an hour. See [HELP#updates] for details.
Updated the [HELP] file.
Word highlighting didn't work if the word was the entire line.
Searching files less than 2 bytes long would crash trying to determine if the file ended with a new line.
Can limit search to tick files only by selecting "search ticked files" on ribbon.
Can search for selected text by selecting some text, right-clicking and selecting "search for selected text" or "search for selected text in ticked files".
Can search for words by holding the Ctrl key and clicking on the word to search for. Hold Shift+Ctrl to search in tick files only.
Word highlighting. Click on a word to highlight all occurrences throughout the document. Can be disabled in Options > View
Selection highlighting. Select some text to highlight all occurrences throughout the document. Can be disabled in Options > View
Added Sublime Text 3 and Visual Studio Code as predefined text editors in Options > Results > Change text editor > Predefined
Updated all third party components to the latest versions.
Added missing third party acknowledgements in About > Third Party Components
Forgot to add ShellLib to the installer - fixed now.
Matches at the very beginning of lines are now highlighted correctly.
Removed the line number highlighter as it is no longer required.
Shell extension menu options are now available when right-clicking on a file (e.g. source control, virus scanner etc)
Line numbers are now shown in their own area to the left of the file contents. Removes the need for hacks to deal with the cursor being in the line number area and looks neater.
Cursor position is now shown at the bottom-right of the screen.
Navigating forwards caused crash if no file selected.
Alt+tab would show an icon for the notification tray icon.

Search history. Added back and forward buttons to navigate through history. Right-click the buttons to see the history. Pre-requisite for starting searches based on selected text, which was added in 0.27 - see [HELP#history] for details.
Single instance option. Allowing multiple instances can be disabled in the Grind and tray options.
Fixed replaces being one character out on the first line of a UTF encoded file.
Fixed ArgumentOutOfRangeException when switching between Whole File and Matches Only after a Replace.

In-application updating now gives more control to the user during the installation. Was previously overly aggressive in automatically closing applications during the installation. The first update to 0.21+ is still aggressive, but it should be better from then on.
Added command line interface, which exports results to a tab separated file. Get help with Grind.CommandLine.exe /?

Overhauled the update system. Checks for updates at startup. Update release notes can be viewed prior to downloading. Updates can be downloaded and installed with a single click. See [HELP#updates] for details.
Overhauled the error reporting system. Error reports are now logged directly in the bug tracking system, rather than by email.
Fixed crash at startup if PATH environment variable included quoted entries.
Reinstated support for UNC search paths. Was inadvertently broken when Pri.LongPath was introduced in v0.16

Notification tray icon that enables global hot keys for running Grind (Windows+G), running with the current selected text (Windows+S), or running with the current clipboard text (Windows+K). The tray icon is enabled during installation or in Options > General > Integration. Hot keys can be customised by right-clicking on the tray icon and selecting Options. See [HELP#tray] for more details.
Customise syntax highlighting file extensions in Options > File Contents.
Simplified how the Match Case and Match Whole Word options are handled. Makes no difference to the user, but makes the code easier to maintain.
Syntax highlighting of SQL files.
Attachments are now zipped when emailing error reports.
Fixed error when searching long directory paths. Now uses Pri.LongPath for all path operations.
Fixed crash when retrieving file icons in Windows 10.
Switching between "whole file" and "matches only" now retains the current cursor position as closely as possible.
Updated installer .NET check to accommodate .NET Framework 4.6
Fixed error when trying to search UNC paths.
Can now use Ctrl+Left and Ctrl+Right to navigate to previous and next matches. See [HELP#navigation] for details.
Now retains existing newlines at the end of files during replace. Previously these were removed.
Added regular expression builder buttons with quick links to common regular expression elements.
Changed "exclude extension" to a more general "exclusions" option, which allows file and folder masks using ? and * wildcards. Set in Options > Search > Exclusions
Interface update routines could sometimes be called from the wrong thread.
Replace now supports regular expression replacing. See [HELP#replace] for details.
Files for replacing can be selected or un-selected using the tick boxes. Click or right-click on the column header to tick or un-tick all items at once.
Next/previous match buttons now move to the next/previous file at the last/first match. Can be disabled in the Options screen.
Moved the match navigation controls to just above the file contents. Less mouse movement required when navigating through matches.
Syntax highlighting of Visual Basic and Python files.
Updated all third party components to the latest versions.
Replace text now has history.
Now retains file encoding and new line style during replace. Previously turned all replaced files into UTF-8 with CRLF new lines.
Detects and disallows regular expression searches that match all characters, such as "dog||cat".
Detects and reports folders that are too long (maximum of 248 characters).
Limited thread creation when searching network drives. Appears to improve search performance.
Can now replace matches with a simple literal replace function. See [HELP#replace] for details.
Can perform "whole word only" searches.
Made "match case" and "match whole word only" options available on the ribbon interface.
Increased the text box history drop-downs to 20 items (was 10 before).
Consolidated the built-in plug-ins into a single assembly.
Opening file in text editor would not find correct line in "matches only" mode.
Fixed the "context lines" option not being saved correctly.

Can now search directly from the ribbon interface. Change search options in Options > Search. Alt+S, Alt+M and ALt+F to jump to search boxes. Old search dialog is available as advanced search. Menu and toolbar interface is as it was before. See [HELP#advancedoptions] for details.
Stop search shortcut changed to Ctrl+Break (the old Ctrl+X shortcut would cut selected text from the search boxes).
Start-up speed improvements.
Fixed occasional timing/ordering problems at start-up on Windows 8.
Can drag files from the results list into other applications, such as Visual Studio, Notepad++, Explorer etc.

Now stores settings in a SQLite database. This reduces some of the oddities that could be seen when running multiple instances and changing settings in each. Imports existing settings into the database on first run.
Improved reporting (in the search dialog) of the reasons why search criteria might be invalid (such as a previously searched folder no longer existing).
Can switch between the ribbon interface and a more traditional menu and toolbar interface. See [HELP#menuandtoolbar] for details.
Can specify a custom text editor to open files in within the Options screen.
Can navigate matches with just the cursor keys when focus is on the results list. Up and Down move between files, Left and Right move between matches within a file. See [HELP#navigation] for details.
Copied text now excludes the lines numbers added by Grind.
Syntax highlighting of Pascal/Delphi files.
Repeating a search on a now invalid location caused an unhandled error.
Added shell extension. Can now start a search by right-clicking on a folder and selecting "Search with Grind". See [HELP#shellextension] for details.
Added splash screen to give more immediate feedback that Grind is in fact launching.
Start-up speed improvements.
Scrolling through results list no longer shows each file as it goes along. Results in faster scrolling and less disc reading.
Tidied up the ribbon interface a bit.
Added Options screen.
Shows matches in the scrollbar. Can be disabled in the Options screen.
Search could sometimes fail due to threading issues while loading internal resources.
Recently used criteria files are listed in the ribbon menu.
Moved log files from installation folder to profile folder.
Improved catching and logging of errors during searching.
Failed to open files in Notepad.
Fixed searches not completing under certain circumstances.
Shows first match when file is selected.
Buttons to move to first, last, next and previous matches.
Save and load search criteria to and from file.
Optimised highlighting logic - much faster with thousands of matches.
Copying filename or location to clipboard could sometimes lock the app.
Fixed highlighting adjacent matches not always working.
